Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape, rounded base, flat ledge rim, one tubular handle on the shoulder, other handle is missing. Exterior is decorated in dark red paint with spirals of varying sizes and wavy lines running between some of them; bands of wavy lines are painted above and over the handles; the flat rim is painted with a crosshatched pattern.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D67c and D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Published: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, Ravenna 1998, p.185 [121-123]. P. Pasini [ed.], Kemet: Guide all mostra, Ravenna 1998, p.11. A.J. Spencer, Pottery in Predynastic Egypt in I. Freestone and D. Gaimster, Pottery in the Making: World ceramic traditions. British Museum Press, London (1997), p. 49
Condition: fair (incomplete -one handle lost), surface worn in places
